abstract: DealBook’s rundown of the latest league tables for the world of mergers and acquisitions, with data provided by Thomson Reuters.
snippet: DealBook’s rundown of the latest league tables for the world of mergers and acquisitions, with data provided by Thomson Reuters.
lead_paragraph: A surprisingly busy August, led by BHP Billiton’s $39 billion hostile offer for Potash, drove global merger activity in the third quarter to its highest level in two years.

abstract: BHP Billiton and Rio Tinto’s joint $116 billion iron-ore venture in Australia has stalled in the face of regulations, and is being reevaluated by executives of the two firms, The Wall Street Journal reported, citing people familiar with the matter.
snippet: BHP Billiton and Rio Tinto’s joint $116 billion iron-ore venture in Australia has stalled in the face of regulations, and is being reevaluated by executives of the two firms, The Wall Street Journal reported, citing people familiar with the matter...
lead_paragraph: BHP Billiton and Rio Tinto’s joint $116 billion iron-ore venture in Australia has stalled in the face of regulations, and is being reevaluated by executives of the two firms, The Wall Street Journal reported, citing people familiar with the matter.

headline.main: BHP and Rio Suspend Venture in Face of Regulations

abstract: Sinochem, China’s top chemicals company, is working hard to come up with a challenge to BHP Billiton’s $39 billion bid for Potash Corp., according to Reuters.
snippet: Sinochem, China’s top chemicals company, is working hard to come up with a challenge to BHP Billiton’s $39 billion bid for Potash Corp., according to Reuters.
lead_paragraph: Sinochem, China’s top chemicals company, is working hard to come up with a challenge to BHP Billiton‘s $39 billion bid for Potash Corporation of Saskatchewan, according to Reuters, but efforts to secure a Russian partner reportedly have failed.

headline.main: Sinochem Said to Work Hard on Rival Potash Bid
